intro: Leontodon rothii, commonly known as Roth's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Leontodon rothii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
